result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiwanna R Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at a rate of $25.00 per month commencing 9/01/2016; Payment plan fee added of $15.00; alternate 7 days huber jail.
Restitution to be paid to Waukesha Clerk of Courts with surcharges within 1 year of today; failure to pay may result in contempt of court. (restitution will go to Rocky Rococo)
DNA costs to be paid on payment plan along with fine.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tiwanna R Williams in court with attorney Katie B. Bricco.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Bricco makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 
The Court Orders the Following:  Count #1.  
FINE: $505.00
DNA Surcharge: $200.00
Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid at the rate of $25.00 per month commencing 9/1/2016. Failure to pay;  the Court orders the defendant to serve 7 days in Huber 

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
Restitution: $1,000.00 to be paid to Rocky Rococo, by being paid to the Waukesha County Clerk of Courts with surcharge within 1 year of today's date.  Failure to pay restitution may result in contempt of court.

Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
